config.description: Analyze frequency content of sensor observations

tuning_runs.result: PASSED - 95% energy in only 5 frequency components (out of 2002)
tuning_runs.notes: Temperature signals are extremely low-frequency. FFT compression is theoretically possible.

config.description: Check correlation between frequency and time domain RMSE

tuning_runs.notes: Frequency RMSE is equivalent to time RMSE (Parseval's theorem). No ranking advantage.

config.description: Timing analysis: simulation vs RMSE computation

tuning_runs.result: FAILED - Simulation is 14,721x slower than RMSE computation
tuning_runs.notes: Simulation: 1207ms, RMSE: 0.082ms. Bottleneck is simulation, not RMSE. Frequency domain can't help.

finding: Frequency domain RMSE requires full simulation first. RMSE computation is only 0.082ms (vs 1207ms simulation). Optimizing frequency domain doesn't reduce simulation cost. frequency_domain family EXHAUSTED.
